Info.Description: Generates a series of progressively lower-resolution versions of the input image. These 'mipmaps' are often used in 3D graphics to improve rendering efficiency and texture quality when objects are viewed from a distance, reducing aliasing and preserving detail.

Properties.Name: Level
Properties.Summary: Controls the resolution level of the mipmap being displayed. A higher level corresponds to a lower-resolution version of the image, while a lower level retains more of the original detail. Adjusting this property allows fine-tuning of texture sharpness and detail based on viewing distance.
